meanings.definition: A downward stroke, especially in writing or drawing.
meanings.sent1: She practiced her downstroke in calligraphy class.
meanings.sent2: His pencil moved smoothly in a downstroke on the paper.
meanings.sent3: The downstroke of her pen made the letter look elegant.
meanings.sent4: The artist's downstroke brought life to the sketch.
meanings.sent5: The downstroke of the brush created a beautiful line on the canvas.

meanings.definition: A downward movement, as in music or sports.
meanings.sent1: The guitarist's downstroke on the strings was powerful.
meanings.sent2: The swimmer's downstroke propelled him through the water.
meanings.sent3: The downstroke of the baton signaled the start of the race.
meanings.sent4: Her downstroke on the piano keys was full of emotion.
meanings.sent5: The runner's downstroke of the arm helped him maintain speed.
